result.execSummary:
All charges against LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to DISMISS is granted by the Court WITHOUT PREJUDICE.

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 10/24/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Court called KMCI and was informed that defendant did not appear for his zoom hearing despite notice.  Court reviewed defendant's previously filed prompt disposition request.  Defense counsel requests case be set for final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defendant needs additional time to review materials with his client. Court adjourns matter for a pre-trial conference in Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood in custody appearing via zoom.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Police Oficer Alexander Nuta  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  The clerk was made aware of the Prompt Dispo and the next court date was given by that clerk.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition Received 7-11-22, filed.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody. Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on an active arrest. Defendant is housed at Dodge and not scheduled to appear by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Avery L Goodrich in court, defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Hearing. Defense recently appointed and request matter set back to preliminary hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35
Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE-V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 35
Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with A.M.G. (DOB 10/18/1998); A.A.G. (DOB 2/12/1975); B.A.V. (DOB 11/25/2003); or J.L.S. (DOB 4/23/1982)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  LaDonte Tyreyeon Haywood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
